Definition: Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.
Condition(s):
ele-1:All FHIR elements must have a @value or children {children().count() > id.count()}
ext-1:Must have either extensions or value[x], not both {extension.exists() != value.exists()}choice-1:shr-core-Reported-extension SHALL have either extension('boolean') or extension('informationsource') {( extension('boolean').url | extension('informationsource').url ).distinct().count() == 1}

Definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.
Indicates if this record was captured as a secondary 'reported' record rather than as an original primary source-of-truth record. It may also indicate the source of the report.
The originator or source of the information or request: a practitioner, patient, related person, organization, an algorithm, device, etc.

Short: identifies the meaning of the extension
Definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
